docs.text: Modeling and Visualization This is a one semester course on modeling and visualization in machine learning.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: This is a one semester course on modeling and visualization in machine learning.
docs.title: Modeling and Visualization

docs.text: Resources More resources will be added as we cover new material. Textbook References Mathematics for Machine Learning [A. Aldo Faisal, Cheng Soon Ong, and Marc Peter Deisenroth] Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning [Christopher M. Bishop] Packages We will be using Python for this course. I assume you have used Conda to install Python into your computer. It is a good practice to create a new Conda environment for a new project like this course. Creating a new Conda environment This is how you create a new Conda environment with named stat786 and how to install packages such as NumPy and pandas conda create -n stat786 conda activate stat786 conda install numpy pandas We will often use Jupyter Notebook . For your new environment to appear in Jupyter Notebook: conda activate stat786 conda install -c anaconda ipykernel python -m ipykernel install --user --name stat786 --display-name "786"

docs.text: This is how you create a new Conda environment with named stat786 and how to install packages such as NumPy and pandas conda create -n stat786 conda activate stat786 conda install numpy pandas We will often use Jupyter Notebook . For your new environment to appear in Jupyter Notebook: conda activate stat786 conda install -c anaconda ipykernel python -m ipykernel install --user --name stat786 --display-name "786"
